generator: { prime(X) : num(X) }. composite(X) :- num(X), num(Y), Y < X, X \ Y = 0.

hard_constraints.description: We must ensure that any number identified as prime truly meets the criteria: it must not have any divisors other than one and itself, meaning it cannot be a composite number.
Conversely, we must ensure that no prime numbers are missed; if a number in our domain has no divisors and is therefore not composite, it must be included in our set of primes.
